description: Represents a nonstandard or dialectal (in particular Cockney) pronunciation of bother.

entries.meaning: (Britain, slang) Violence, especially that associated with youth gangs.
examples: In London there are some thirty gangs of “bovver birds,” violence-prone girls who roam the streets in packs attacking almost any vulnerable object for no apparent reason other than the sheer thrill of it.

verbs.description: bovver (third-person singular simple present bovvers, present participle bovvering, simple past and past participle bovvered)

examples: "You specials," Nigel said disgustedly. "I don't know why I bovver, really I don't."
